JobDescription:
Qualifications:
High School diploma. Graduate of a medical assistant program. Successful completion of the certification/registration exam. 2 years of experience in an ambulatory clinic setting. Contact center or similar environment experience helpful. 40 to 55 wpm. Excellent communication skills. Basic customer service skills. Basic problem solving skills. Demonstrates accuracy and attention to detail. Self-directed. Ability to handle a high call volume environment while maintaining high performance. Willingness to work flexible hours. Excellent computer skills. Experience in Microsoft Word and Excel helpful. Ability to work in a team environment. Ability to follow procedures. Significant medical terminology knowledge. CMA Ability to work under stressful conditions with demanding customers. Ability to work varying shifts to meet the needs of the department. Ability to work in a changing environment. Ability to prioritize independently and respond to multiple simultaneous requests. Hours may be irregular due to 24/7 operations of contact center. Ability to sit for prolonged periods of time. Ability to use computer terminal for extended timeframes.
Job Description:
LOCATION: ROSEMONT, IL Position is on evening shift - 3p-11pm. This position is responsible for fielding and resolving telephone calls and other contact methods in the Advocate Patient Contact Center, specifically related to the Nurse Advice queue. Expectations of this role include providing exceptional customer service, treating all callers with dignity and respect, striving to anticipate and meet the needs of Advocate patients, and working collaboratively with contact center nurses and other staff to achieve quality and performance standards. Accountabilities: 1. Customer Care and Service Excellence 2. Other Duties

JobDescription:
Qualifications:
? Bachelor's degree in Accounting from an accredited program. ? Proficient in personal computers and applications (ie. Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word). ? Good analytical skills? Proficient in the use of a 10 key calculator. ? Good communication skills? . Good organization skills ? Accountants are required to complete all monthly financial close responsibilities by their predetermined due dates. This may require overtime or weekend work which they are to plan for accordingly. ? Weekend work will be required during the annual audit which includes the month of January February (minimum four) and encompasses inventory testing in October (minimum one) and other interim work in the months of September through December as needed). ? Travel to operating units may be required but this generally is on a limited basis.
Job Description:
Establish and maintain accounting and tax records and prepare reports for one or more companies of Advocate Health Care Network (AHCN) to ensure the accurate and timely recording and reporting of financial activity and control over the System's asset and liability accounts. The number of companies and/or facilities assigned depends on the nature and size of their financial activity. Accountabilities: 1. Accurate and adequately supported journal entries 2. Accurate monthly financial statements and reports issued on a timely basis 3. Thorough analysis and presentation of assigned facilities' profit and loss statement 4. Accurate and adequately supported workpapers and reconciliations of assigned facilities' balance sheet and income statement accounts 5. State and federal tax returns and other government filings 6. Accurate and timely audit schedules for the annual audit. 7. Implementation of accounting procedures. 8. Special projects as assigned
JobDescriptionHTML:
Qualifications:

? Bachelor's degree in Accounting from an accredited program.

? Proficient in personal computers and applications (ie. Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word).

? Good analytical skills? Proficient in the use of a 10 key calculator.

? Good communication skills?

. Good organization skills

? Accountants are required to complete all monthly financial close responsibilities by their predetermined due dates. This may require overtime or weekend work which they are to plan for accordingly.

? Weekend work will be required during the annual audit which includes the month of January February (minimum four) and encompasses inventory testing in October (minimum one) and other interim work in the months of September through December as needed).

? Travel to operating units may be required but this generally is on a limited basis.

Job Description:

Establish and maintain accounting and tax records and prepare reports for one or more companies of Advocate Health Care Network (AHCN) to ensure the accurate and timely recording and reporting of financial activity and control over the System's asset and liability accounts. The number of companies and/or facilities assigned depends on the nature and size of their financial activity.

Accountabilities:

1. Accurate and adequately supported journal entries

2. Accurate monthly financial statements and reports issued on a timely basis

3. Thorough analysis and presentation of assigned facilities' profit and loss statement

4. Accurate and adequately supported workpapers and reconciliations of assigned facilities' balance sheet and income statement accounts

 5. State and federal tax returns and other government filings

6. Accurate and timely audit schedules for the annual audit.

7. Implementation of accounting procedures.

 8. Special projects as assigned

JobDescription:
Qualifications:
? Bachelor degree in medical field or business management. Advanced classes with commitment to complete advanced degree. ? Minimum 7 ? 8 years management and technical experience medical laboratory with a Histology lab experience preferred . ? Leadership experience in integrated or consolidated laboratory preferred. Broad knowledge of Microsoft Office and strong computer literacy. Knowledge of LIS systems. ? Certification as a medical laboratory scientist, medical technologist, medical laboratory technician, or other appropriate licensure. ? Effectively lead organization through change required to meet ACL's cost reduction and service improvement requirements through effective leadership and an ability to facilitate rapid change.
Job Description:
Incumbent will be responsible for executive leadership of a large, complex, multifaceted operation through the coordination of all technical, logistical, and administrative functions to ensure prompt and accurate testing and reporting of results for clinical laboratory samples within established timeframes. Accountabilities: 1. Daily Operations 2. Daily Operations 3. Strategic Involvement 4. Strategic Involvement (Accountability C continued...) 5. Team Building/Human Resources 6. Client Involvement 7. Collateral Duties

JobDescription:
Qualifications:
Requirements: High School Diploma or GED CNA preferred Prior experience preferred Computer skills, microphone, telephone, projector are necessary Requires critical thinking skills, decisive judgment and the ability to work with minimal supervision Frequent standing, bending, reaching, kneeling, moving, lifting equipment up to 50 lb Follows Standard Precautions using personal protective equipment as required for procedures
Job Description:
Advocate Sherman West Court is a 112 bed skilled nursing and rehab facility, fully licensed by the State of Illinois, Medicare certified and JCAHO accredited. Sherman West Court provides its residents and patients with short and long-term medical and nursing care, as well as rehabilitation and social services. The activities assistant will be responsible for carrying out daily activity programs to ensure the recreational and social needs of the residents and patients of Sherman West Court. Job Duties: Provide individual and group activities in accordance with care planning needs in association with Activities director Interacting directly with residents and patients in a positive uplifting attitude to gain a trusting relationship Teamwork with other departments to give patients centered care Position requires Wheelchair transportation, with majority of standing throughout shift Must posses organizational skills that are essential for timely activities with proper documentation Able to work with minimal supervision to lead and assist in activities Able to present and speak to large groups of people and give direction in a caring compassionate and positive manner Various other duties entail ; shopping at local stores, family interaction to communicate resident/patient gains

Qualifications:

Requirements:

  • CNA preferred
  • Prior experience preferred
  • Computer skills, microphone, telephone, projector are necessary
  • Requires critical thinking skills, decisive judgment and the ability to work with minimal supervision
  • Frequent standing, bending, reaching, kneeling, moving, lifting equipment up to 50 lb
  • Follows Standard Precautions using personal protective equipment as required for procedures

    The activities assistant will be responsible for carrying out daily activity programs to ensure the recreational and social needs of the residents and patients of Sherman West Court.

     

    Job Duties:

  • Provide individual and group activities in accordance with care planning needs in association with Activities director
  • Interacting directly with residents and patients in a positive uplifting attitude to gain a trusting relationship
  • Teamwork with other departments to give patients centered care
  • Position requires Wheelchair transportation, with majority of standing throughout shift

  • Able to work with minimal supervision to lead and assist in activities
  • Able to present and speak to large groups of people and give direction in a caring compassionate and positive manner
  • Various other duties entail ; shopping at local stores, family interaction to communicate resident/patient gains

JobDescription:
Qualifications:
This position is for a Registered Nurse ? Graduate from an accredited school of nursing ? 2-3 years of medical nursing experience with various age groups. ? Good communication and interpersonal skills ? Good documentation skills. ? Computer skills ? Good time management and organizational skills ? Familiarity with patient care equipment * Good customer service skills ? Current Illinois RN license ? Curent CPR ? Ability to work weekends, holidays, and different shifts in order to accommodate staffing ? Ability to take ?on call? assignments. ? Ability to handle multiple tasks and complete work within short timeframes. ? Ability to transport objects, patients, and equipment ? Ability to respond quickly to patient needs and work at fast pace ? Work environment includes probability of exposure to adverse, hazardous, or unpleasant conditions while caring for the sick ? Routinely works with potentially infectious specimens and patients ? Ability to respond to patients in a timely manner and access all areas ? Ability to lift up to 100 pounds occasionally and/or in excess of 50 pounds frequently and/or in excess of 20 pounds constantly ? Must be able to travel to all areas within the Advocate service area in all extremes of weather on all types of roads. Exposed to widely varying social and environmental conditions in patient?s neighborhoods and homes. Must be willing to work occasional overtime if needed. Required to make visits to private residences which may not be accessible to people with disabilities. ? Must be able to assist with ambulation including turning and transferring patients up to 200 pounds
Job Description:
The admission nurse assumes primary responsibility for the admission of patients into the hospice program. The admission process includes the assessment, planning, and implementation of the plan of treatment. The admission nurse ensures admission to the hospice program and smooth transition and hand off to the IDT. Communication with the hospital, physicians and other care providers is essential. Accountabilities: 1. Responsible for the admission process to hospice services. 2. Assuring/Improving Quality Care: Facilitates the patient and family?s right to receive quality, cost effective care 3. Patient/Staff Education: Demonstrates a commitment to meeting the learning needs of patients and families. Utilizes appropriate resources to meet those needs and achieve positive patient outcomes. 4. Leadership/Collaboration/Professional Development: Demonstrates respect and understanding for peers and other clinical disciplines and participates as an effective member of the patient care team to formulate an integrated approach to care. Demonstrates leadership behaviors and is committed to the development of self and others. This position will work primarily in the north and north suburb area. Start time will be late morning. Hrs will be 11am-7pm.

JobDescription:
Qualifications:
? Masters Degree in Nursing. ? 1 years clinical experience in family practice (adults and pediatrics) or new graduate with 5 years of clinical experience (adults and pediatrics) ? This position will need to recognize needs and behaviors of a variety of age groups of patients and provide age appropriate care. ? Well developed written skills. ? Well developed interpersonal and communication skills. ? Performs adequate psychological and physical assessment of patients. -PC literate ? National certification as a Nurse Practitioner. ? Current Illinois APN License ? Current Illinois Registered Nurse license. - Ability to travel between centers. Maybe required to work at more than one center within the same day. - Ability to perform physical tasks such as lifting patients and moving equipment. - Ability to work varying shifts to meet the needs of the center. Early mornings, evenings and weekends required - Able to respond quickly to patient needs and work at a fast pace. - Work under stressful conditions and in difficult situations. - The candidate must be able to perform physical tasks such as lifting patients and moving equipment. - Work environment includes the probability of exposure to adverse, hazardous or unpleasant conditions while caring for the sick.
Job Description:
Nurse practitioners assess and manage both medical and nursing problems. Their practice emphasizes health promotion and maintenance, disease prevention and the diagnosis and management of acute and chronic diseases. This includes taking histories, conducting physical examinations, ordering, performing and interpreting appropriate diagnostic and laboratory tests, prescription of pharmacological agents, treatments and non-pharmacological therapies for the management of the conditions, which they diagnose. The Nurse Practitioner provides direct patient care to adult and pediatric patients through established guidelines that are consistent with the Illinois Nurse Practice Act Accountabilities: 1. Direct Patient Care 4. Education/Certification 3. Interdisciplinary/Collaborative Responsibilities 2. Accountability A Continued...
